As you live and enjoy the breaths you take today and tonight before you go to sleep in preparation for your life tomorrow, kiss the ones you love, snuggle a little tighter, and never take one second of your life for granted.
Also all those still dealing with the aftermath with cancer and losing their loved ones. Never EVER Forget

post_text: I am so proud to be a part of the Fair Play teamEveryone works together to get the job done. This year is a great example of how hard the team works everyday to get the job done. On March 16th we made the decision we needed to close due to COVID. In THREE days (while on spring break) everyone pulled together and revamped our schools so we were able to get learning packets out and meals out on the first day we were actually closed for COVID. We knew our students and our parents needed us and we wanted to be there. This includes our bus drivers, cooks, custodians, nurse, principals and aides. ALL of the staff have missed the kids and will be so happy when our buildings are full again. Every year I say how awesome our staff is and this year shows how exceptionally dedicated they have been and will be when we are all together again.

Ill be posting later today how we are sending learning packets and grab and go meals. I will send a phone call after work hours tonight sharing the plans. Take care of yourself and your family and things will work out.

Ag Ed/FFA Family,
In light of the current health issues and concerns resulting from the coronavirus (COVID-19), the State FFA Convention scheduled for April 23 and 24 is being postponed. Ag Ed staff members are working on a contingency plan for the State Convention program, State Leadership Development and State Career Development Events. My recommendation is that you reconsider holding all area and district FFA events involving significant numbers of students. While a variety of factors go into making a decision like this, be assured that the health and safety of our students and stakeholders is always our primary concern.

As an association we know there will be questions. We are evlauating all options as we move through the next few days and weeks. Continue to check with your advisor and watch social media.

Corona Virus update:

Our custodians have been in flu cleaning mode for quite some time now.
We have sprayers that can spray disinfectant into rooms and hallways. Our disinfectants are rated for COVID-19. We are wiping surfaces, such as desktops, tables, water fountains, and doorknobs to name a few, daily. Custodians are spraying down bus seats to prevent the spread of germs.
Our teachers and nurse are emphasizing proper and frequent hand washing to all students.
If your student is sick, keep them at home.
We are hoping to prevent the spread of unnecessary germs!
